Pauly-Wissowa: 5. Halbbd., col. 1206-1207; "Caecilius", #81 (Q. Caecilius Metellus; pontifex 216 B.C.; tribune, 209 B.C.; aedile, 208 B.C.; consul, 206 B.C.; headed a legation to Macedonia, 186 B.C.; attempted reconciliation of the censors M. Aemilius Lepidus and M. Fulvius Nobiliar, 179 B.C.)

NUC pre-56: v. 378, p. 361 (Metellus, Quintus Caecilius)

Malcovati, E. Oratorum romanorum fragmenta rei liberae publicae, 1955: p. 9-10 (Q. Caecilius L.P. Metellus; pontifex 216 B.C.; tribune 209 B.C.; aedile 208 B.C.; consul, 206 B.C.; decemvir 201 B.C.; headed a legation to Macedonia 186 B.C.; enemy of the poet Naevius)

Dict. of Greek and Roman biography and mythology, 1967: v. 2, p. 1056-1067, "Metellus", #2 (Q. Caecilius L.f. L.n. Metellus; pontifex, 216 B.C.; plebian aedile, 209 B.C.; curule aedile, 208 B.C.; consul 206 B.C.; decemvir, 201 B.C.; made an address to the censors, 179 B.C.)
